 From another thread:

Derek Pappas wrote:
> On Feb 2, 2010, at 8:41 AM, Gordon Mohr wrote:
> 
>> Derek Pappas wrote:
>>> Gordon,
>>>
>>> We are building a vertical search engine and are using Heritrix
>>>
>>> 1. As far as checking pointing is concerned is it supposed to work  
>> in
>>> 1.xxx.
>>> My experience has been that it does not work as advertised.
>> In H1, checkpointing should work, though it requires a full pause, and
>> if using custom/contributed components (such as processors) they might
>> not all support checkpointing. Can you be more specific about how it  
>> has
>> failed?
>>
>>
> Some times the check point hangs.
> Some times the check point can't be reloaded.
> We are using a complex regex to eliminate every file type except html.

If you have a reproduceable hang, or time to investigate an intermittent 
occurrence, it would be useful to capture:

  - general machine/crawl parameters/scale/activity at time of hang
  - any suspicious log output/errors around the time of checkpoint, or 
errors seen on the resume
  - the output of a java '-SIGQUIT' or 'jstack' thread dump

- Gordon @ IA
